page.title: 16St. Clements Church Tower
page.content: The church tower is the highest point in this area. It is built of Kentish ragstone and flint. It is 80 foot high. The 99 steps are steep and narrow and keep on winding until you feel dizzy. We stopped on the 56th step to see where they rang the bells. There are six bells and twenty bellringers and the youngest is aged ten. Every Wednesday they practise from 7-9pm. We all had a go on the treble bell. It was difficult and once I went right up in the air. After we had looked at the bells which were huge, we carried on to the top of the tower. From the top we could see lots of things, the sea, some boats, many houses and even the pier. Written by Sarah Bevan Jones (9yrs) Vanessa Irvine (10yrs), Marc Ramis (11yrs)
